Description: Fragment of a circular lid, probably from a vessel, made of blue and white glazed composition, decorated with remains of a representation of three horned quadrupeds running.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Maj Charles Kerr Macdonald
Curator's comments: Cooney, JEA 58 (1972): 284, pl. XLV. G. Pinch, Magic in Ancient Egypt (London 1994), p.306.
